review_blob: This one comes highly recommended by my local liquor store clerk.  Pours a deep clear amber with light foamy white head.  Aroma is malty and swampy/earthy.  Flavor starts off sharp and tingly and finishes with hints of caramel and coffee.  Interesting...
aroma is sour and earthy.  flavor is bitter, tangy, hoppy (obviously).  Mouthfeel is very carbonated but light finishing.  very pleasing, ill be buying this again.
lighter palate than expected but definitely nutty with slight hoppy flavor.  I will re-rate when I can smell better.
pours a light yellow with frothy head.  Aroma is hoppy and floral.  Flavor is quite bitter but refreshing.  nice clean finish.
pours a slightly hazy medium amber with no head.  Aroma is grainy with hints of apples and grapes and oranges.  Flavor is crisp but not dry.  very refreshing but a little bland.

2007 bottle says "Imperial Red Ale" not Barleywine.  Pours a clear fizzy amber with almost no head.  Aroma is mild with hints of cherry and molasses.  Flavor is very sweet with lots of alcohol and a bit sour.

pours a clear medium amber with light white head.  Aroma is earthy, malty, very lightly hoppy and slightly sweet.  Flavor is lightly sweet, bitter, buttery with a little cherry syrup.  Finishes with a cinnamony tingle at the back of the throat and a dryness on the tongue.

almost black but clear pour with almost no head.  aroma is chocolate, cream, caramel.  feels like a thin cream with medium carbonation... like an ice cream float.  Flavor is mildly sweet but overall a bit bland.  Quite drinkable though.

2007, aroma is of somewhat spiced grains with a slight mustiness.  flavor is very fruity... like a carbonated cran-apple juice.  I remember liking this last year but its a bit on the sweet side for me these days.

2007 - Pours a very dark clear red with small tan head.  Aroma is filled with cinnamon, nutmeg, pine and sugar cookies.  Flavor is brightly spicy, lightly sweet and finishes mildly bitter.  Overall, pretty good and unique but not something Id drink regularly.  Perfect for the holidays.
beer_name: Anchor Our Special Ale (2005 and later)

review_blob: pours a clear light orange with a very sparse white head.  Aroma is light, sweet, grassy, citrus, woody.  Flavor is of light hops, pleasant bitterness, grapefruit, earth.  not sweet or sour at all.  Tingly with a dry finish.

Finally took the plunge.  Pours a nice fizzy amber with thin foamy tan head.  Aroma like nail polish and banana with hints of molasses and raisin.  Flavor is sweet and caramel-like and leaves a tingling sensation from the tip of the tongue to the back of the throat.  I can definitely feel all that alcohol in my mouth and stomach but cant taste it much.  Ends with a dry bitterness a quick buzz due to all the deep smelling!

I had this on tap recently at a local rib joint while waiting for a table.  It looks like a regular pale ale but the flavor is pretty complex.  Its hoppy and bitter but has this wonderful buttery flavor and goes perfectly with BBQ.
pours a hazy golden brown with a thick lacy head.  aroma is citrusy and sour.  Hops come through in the flavor as with most three floyds brews.  Just mild enough to drink a few in a row ;)
beer_name: Three Floyds Pride & Joy Mild Ale

review_blob: pours a hazy yellow with a thick foamy head and lots of lacing.  Aroma is floral and sweet.  he flavor is wonderfully bitter, nipping at the edges of the tongue.  Hoppy with a light sweetness.  So good after a long day at work...
beer_name: Rogue Nation Brutal India Pale Ale

review_blob: pours a funky pinkish amber.  smells mildly fruity.  Tastes like rotten apple juice and alcohol.  Has  an odd slimy mouthfeel.  I havent so far been a fan of any gluten free brews and this is no exception.  This is supposed to be a bitter?

date on bottle is 03/2006
pours almost black with a thin tan head.  aroma is coffee, malts, light sweet fruits.  Flavor is like a chewy resin candy and strong coffee.  finishes kind of dry with just a hint of lingering bitterness

pours a light golden amber with little white head.  Aroma: not much really, some hops and some slight citrus.  Flavor is like biting into an orange or lemon peel.  Very bitter and sharp ending with an oily woodiness.  Quite tasty!
pours a slightly hazy dark amber.  Aroma: applejuice, hay, lemon - interesting...  Flavor: quite bitter with just a little tiny bit of sweetness.  Starts very thin but lingers pleasantly.

pours a hazy dark amber with a fluffy thick head.  Aroma is hoppy with caramel-like undertones and a bit of lemon/grapefruit.  flavor is very hoppy and dry with some hidden sweetness and toast.  leaves a light tingle on the edges of my tongue.
Im overall not a fan of Bock styles but this is a good one.  Sweet, but enough bitterness to even it out.  spicy and roasty.
this one gives me a headache every time...  cloudy yellow, nice aroma of wheat, banana and citrus.  Tastes sweet & spicy.  nice overall but I tend to stay away from it and most wheats.

Bottled: Jan 2006
pours a beautiful almost black with a reddish tint and a thick tan head that dissipates quickly to a light lacing that remains.  aroma is brown sugar and a little chocolate... one of the best smelling brews Ive had.  Mouthfeel is creamy and chewy.  tastes roasty and malty with a nice bitterness.

pours a clear yellow with light bubbly head.  Aroma is doughy and a little musty.  flavor is light with a little citrus hidden.  Very little carbonation.  overall kind of empty.  However, this is a summer beer and I bought it in October (bottle was dusty) so it may be a freshness issue (?)
simple but good.  A nice bittersweet brew with a molasses flavor and a dryish finish.  I could drink a few of these...
UPDATED: OCT 12, 2007
pours a misty soft amber with a huge lacy head.  very aromatic indeed... hoppy and a bit fruity.  flavor is sour to dry with hints of fruity sweetness.  very bubbly.  interesting.

pours a very bubbly amber with almost no head.  the aroma is very mild and the flavor doesnt offer much more.   It has a nice malty finish though.  I guess I kind of expected more here.  Its not bad, just not that interesting.

med. amber/orange with almost no head.  Smells very pumpkininny with hints of other fall veggies and nutmeg.  the flavor it a bit sour & dry which is a surprise.  It has much more pumpkin flavor than spices or alcohol.  Interesting, but not my favorite fall brew.
I think the spices are a bit overdone here but once it warms up a bit the flavors blend a little better.  Not my favorite pumpkin beer and not something Id want to drink much of, but decent.
Im not very experienced with the Oktoberfest style but this was quite tasty.  Roasty, warm & malty.  A nice standard, drinkable beer.
pours a pretty amber/pink with light head/lacing.  smells amazing... orange, pineapple, & hops.  tingly & bittersweet on the tongue with a creaminess that Ive not experienced in an IPA.

a beautiful black stout with just a bit of tan head, thick lacing... smells very sweet like caramel but lighter with a slight sharpness.  Tastes like bitter chocolate and coffee beans finishing with a dark roastiness.  The alcohol is more detectable by taste than smell.  overall, quite tasty and drinkable.
beer_name: North Coast Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: I love IPAs and this is no exception...  My first reaction: "wow, thats good!"  Its light and tingly, perfectly hoppy with a light sweetness and an almost roasty flavor.  I cant wait to try the 90 and 120.

Not sure if this is the correct beer... my 25.4oz bottle says "Hell for Certain: Heavenly Belgian Style Ale."
Pours a very hazy dull reddish brown with almost no lacing and a bit of sediment left on the bottom of the glass.  It has a very sharp aroma of dried fruit and caramel.  Flavor is malty and nutty with a bit of sourness.  Finishes with a woody, spicy tingle.  The texture is odd, creamy but kind of sticky...  Overall, I like it better after a few tastes.
UPDATED: FEB 25, 2009

I had this on tap at 3Floyds Dark Lord Day.  Im not normally a big fan of wheats these days but this is an exception.  Has that nice bitter hoppy flavor that I love with a little sourness... Like lemon zest!  Yum!  I could drink this all day...

and I did :)

2007. This is a very hyped up beer and I have to say that I was a bit let down.  I finally made it to Dark Lord Day this year and was lucky enough to get half a glass.  Turns out that half a glass was plenty for the 4 of us to share.  Its a beautiful looking beer, almost solid black.  Kind of like soy sauce and it smells like soy sauce too.  Tastes and feels like molasses.  Very sweet and almost no carbonation.  Admittedly though, Russian Imperial Stouts are not my favorite type of beer so Im glad I didnt spend 3 hours in line to get some to take home.  I enjoyed the Gumballhead most of the day instead :)
beer_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: pours a golden yellow with foamy head.  smells almost like a hard cider, very sweet and tart.  the flavor is a bit bland but not overly fruity.  reminds me a lot of razz wheat but not quite as flavorful.  overall... its ok, not really worth the price.

My first lambic... pours a pretty reddish brown with very little lacing.  aroma is very sour with grapes, corn, and other grains.  Kind of reminds me of a musty basement actually.  tastes unlike anything Ive ever tasted.  very bubbly with lots of fruit (orange, lemon, grape, apple, raspberry...) with a hint of wheat. mouth is sour and dry toward the end.  Nice, but I wouldnt want to drink more than one.    I love the art nouveau bottle label!
UPDATED: SEP 29, 2007
pours a beautiful rich reddish dark brown with a small tan head and little lacing.  Doesnt really smell like much but maybe my sense of smell is off today.  Tastes creamy and nutty and caramel sweet.

a very pretty beer... dark clear amber brown with a small creamy head.  aroma of brown sugar, nuts, malt.  light but creamy mouth ending with a slight tingle. tastes toasty, almonds and wheat with citrus undertones.  A very nice simple ale.

pours a hazy warm yellow with lots of lacing and lots of bubble.  Smells sour, sweet and bitter... strong but kind of not good.  Tastes sweet and sour of juicy poached apricots.  finishes smooth and creamy like a smoothie.

pours a clear amber/yellow with very light lacing.  aroma is stronger than the flavor with the obvious strawberry but also some banana, caramel, orange... the flavor is a somewhat sharp, clean, only slightly fruity mild lager.  Finishes with a sort of bitter orange peel taste.  Very light, not very intersting but a decent casual summer brew.
UPDATED: JUN 25, 2006

pours a slightly hazy light amber/yellow with lacy head. subtle aroma of banana, lemon, orange peel, wheat...  flavor starts bitter moving to creamy with walnut and fruit ending with a bubbly hoppiness.

pours a clear dark amber... more tan than reddish.  almost no head, just the tiniest bit of lacing.  aroma is caramel and banana.  tastes... light, sweet with hints of caramel, roasted coffee beans, taffy... finishes kind of dry.
aroma is sour and hoppy. tastes sweetish and fruity at first and ends with a grapefruity bitterness.  Not my favorite flying dog, nor my favorite IPA but its good!

pours dark amber with a small tan head that dissapates quickly.  smell is slightly sour but very light.  tastes creamy and smooth with toasted bread, chocolate, spices, caramel.  syrupy palate... very creamy with a bubbly sour finish.  good, but not my favorite
